goal.fitness: Improve explosive speed and agility; reduce body fat by 3% for better quickness on the field.
goal.nutrition: Increase lean protein intake to support muscle recovery and maintain strength while cutting; reduce processed carbs and increase hydration.

weekly_routine.Monday: Sprint intervals + agility ladder drills; upper-body strength (bench press, rows, push-ups)
weekly_routine.Tuesday: Plyometrics + resistance band drills; core stability work
weekly_routine.Thursday: Route running with speed cuts + lower-body strength (squats, RDLs, lunges)
weekly_routine.Friday: Full-body HIIT circuit; hand-eye coordination training
weekly_routine.Saturday: Flag football scrimmage or position-specific drills

food_log.Dietary Preferences: Omnivorous with allergies; avoids all nut-based and soy-based products, relies on other protein sources like poultry, eggs, and lentils.
food_log.Breakfast: Avocado toast with scrambled eggs and whole grain bread
food_log.Lunch: Grilled chicken breast, and mixed greens salad with vinaigrette dressing
food_log.Snack 2: Rice cakes with sunflower seed butter and banana slices
food_log.Dinner: Baked chicken breast, roasted broccoli, brown rice

goal.fitness: Improve VO₂ max and running economy; integrate more strength training to prevent injury.
goal.nutrition: Optimize carbohydrate timing for endurance training; maintain a plant-forward diet rich in iron, B12, and omega-3s.

weekly_routine.Tuesday: Tempo run (6 miles) + lower-body strength (goblet squats, deadlifts, step-ups)
weekly_routine.Thursday: Interval training (400m and 800m repeats); upper-body strength and core
weekly_routine.Friday: Long run (8–10 miles at moderate pace)
weekly_routine.Saturday: Recovery jog or swimming; mobility work

food_log.Dietary Preferences: Vegetarian — avoids all meat and fish, consumes dairy and eggs in moderation, prefers whole, minimally processed plant-based foods.
food_log.Breakfast: Smoothie bowl with banana, spinach, almond milk, and chia seeds topped with granola and berries
food_log.Lunch: Lentil soup Whole-grain bread Side salad with light vegetable dressing
food_log.Snack 2: Energy bar (homemade with oats, nuts, and dried fruits)
food_log.Dinner: Grilled portobello mushrooms with roasted sweet potatoes and steamed broccoli
food_log.Hydration: 2-3 liters of water per day, with an additional 1-2 liters on long-run days.

goal.fitness: Enhance core stability and upper-body power for better puck control and physical play.
goal.nutrition: Maintain high caloric intake to match energy expenditure during training; focus on anti-inflammatory foods for recovery.

weekly_routine.Monday: Upper-body hypertrophy (pull-ups, bench press, cable rows); core circuits
weekly_routine.Tuesday: On-ice practice (drills, power skating, stick handling)
weekly_routine.Wednesday: HIIT sled pushes + agility work; recovery stretching
weekly_routine.Saturday: Off-ice mobility + active recovery (light jog or rower)

food_log.Dietary Preferences: Omnivorous — enjoys a wide variety of foods including traditional Korean dishes, prioritizes whole foods with a focus on omega-3s and antioxidants.
food_log.Breakfast: Kimchi omelet with whole-grain toast and a glass of green tea
food_log.Lunch: Bulgogi beef with brown rice and mixed vegetables
food_log.Dinner: Grilled mackerel with sweet potato and steamed broccoli
food_log.Hydration: 4-5 liters of water per day, considering Jackson’s high energy expenditure
